title: Why Antonio Conte needs to watch his back if Chelsea win the Premier League this season
text:
Why Antonio Conte needs to watch his back if Chelsea win the Premier League this season He'd be taking on the new poisoned chalice Share Watch out, Antonio! (Photo: REUTERS) Share Get Chelsea FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Never underestimate the ability of football to surprise you. 
With that in mind, today can be treated as just another day in the crazy world of the sport - as Claudio Ranieri is sacked as Leicester City manager , just NINE months after guiding the 5,000/1 outsiders to their first-ever Premier League title. 
As pundits and fans alike take in the news , there's one man in particular who should be VERY concerned about it - Chelsea gaffer Antonio Conte. 
The Italian has guided the Blues to eight points clear at the top of the Premier League in his debut campaign. And with just 13 games to go, they're firm favourites to win the title. (Photo: REUTERS) 
Normally, this would be a reason to make any manager in that position very happy indeed. But after how recent events have unfolded at the Foxes, Conte is a man who should be made very aware that winning the league is not very good for your job prospects. 
That's because the last two Premier League winning managers have failed to see out their following season. Jose Mourinho - 2014/15 winner 
May 2015: Won the Premier League, finishing eight points clear of Manchester City. 
December 2015: Sacked by Chelsea after their dismal slump in form. Claudio Ranieri - 2015/16 winner 
May 2016: Won the Premier League, finishing 10 points clear of Arsenal. 
February 2017: Sacked by Leicester - despite a vote of no confidence just days before. 
No wonder Gary Neville has labelled winning the title the "new poisoned chalice": 
On top of this, although he didn't win the league himself, David Moyes was fired by champions Manchester United in April 2014 after he failed to defend the title the club had won in the previous campaign. 
So, the evidence is there - on current trend, winning the Premier League gets you fired. Antonio Conte: you have been warned! poll loading Will Chelsea win the title? 1000+ VOTES SO FAR
